pageContext.claim: “We have to get our country back, we have to start moving again, we have to start working again. Now, they're doing tests on airlines -- very strong tests -- for getting on, getting off. They're doing tests on trains -- getting on, getting off.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is not conducting such tests for covid-19, either at airports or train stations. There is some screening being done at 13 international airports, for travelers arriving from certain countries, which could include a temperature check or a questionnaire.
